description: A vegetable from the gourd family, bottle gourds were brought to the Americas by the first Native American settlers crossing the Bering strait.  This one has been dried for processing into a watertight container.
Sugar-free chewing gum.

variants.description: The classic of classics, a flavor that provides a fresh and invigorating sensation in the mouth, as well as freshening breath.
Spearmint is a slightly sweeter and milder version of peppermint, providing a fresher taste and is also good for freshening breath.
Wintergreen has a cool and refreshing taste, similar to mint, but with a slightly sweeter flavor.
Cinnamon is a spicy, bold flavor that's great for clearing the sinuses and providing a burst of flavor.
Bubblegum is a nostalgic flavor that's reminiscent of the classic pink bubblegum flavor that kids love.  It's basically a combination of various flavors.
This flavour is a combination of different berries that provides a fruity, sweet, and tart taste.
This strawberry-flavored chewing gum offers a sweet and juicy taste, reminiscent of fresh strawberries.
This cherry-flavored chewing gum is both sweet and tart, with a delicious fruity flavor.
This grape-flavored chewing gum is fruity and sweet, with a juicy grape flavor.
This orange-flavored chewing gum provides a fresh and fruity taste, like biting into a juicy orange.
This watermelon-flavoured chewing gum has a sweet and fruity flavor, perfect for summertime.
This blueberry-flavored chewing gum has a fruity, tangy flavor with a slightly sweet taste.
This cranberry-flavored chewing gum offers a slight bitterness along with its unique and tangy taste.
This pineapple-flavored chewing gum has a sweet and tangy taste, perfect for those looking for a tropical twist.
This green apple-flavored gum is crisp and refreshing, with a slightly sour and sweet taste, more sour and sweet than the regular apple-flavoured one.
This apple-flavored gum is both crisp and refreshing, with a slightly sweet and sour taste.
This uncommon mango-flavored chewing gum has a sweet, tropical taste, reminiscent of fresh mangos.

name.str_sp: chewing gum, mint chocolate chip flavored

variants.description: Mint chocolate chip is a cross between a mint and chocolate flavor, offering a sweet and slightly creamy taste.
Vanilla is a subtle flavor for chewing gum that provides a sweet and comforting taste.
This coconut-flavoured chewing gum offers a tropical and slightly sweet flavor that's popular during summertime.
This lemonade-flavored chewing gum provides a zesty and citrusy burst of flavor.
This honey-flavored chewing gum has a unique, sweet and rich flavor, offering a unique flavor that's popular among dessert lovers.
This sour apple-flavored chewing gum offers a puckering sensation and tanginess that's popular among candy and snack lovers.
This pomegranate-flavored chewing gum has a blend of tart and sweet taste for a unique, fruity flavour.
This raspberry-flavored chewing gum has a fruity and tart taste with a slightly sweet finish, offering a tangy and refreshing pop of flavor.
This kiwi-flavored chewing gum provides a sweet and tangy taste, reminiscent of fresh kiwis.
This peach-flavored chewing gum offers a sweet, slightly tangy, and earthy taste, reminiscent of fresh peaches.
This passion fruit-flavored chewing gum has a calming, tart and sweet taste, offering a unique and tropical flavor.
This tangerine-flavored chewing gum offers a fresh and zesty taste, with a balance of sweetness and tartness.
This grapefruit-flavored chewing gum has a tangy and slightly bitter taste, with a twist of sweetness.
This blackberry-flavored gum has a sweet taste, combined with a subtle tartness, offering a fruity and refreshing flavor.
This uncommon lime-flavored chewing gum provides a tangy and refreshing taste, not exactly similar to biting into a fresh lime, because they are way too sour.
This peach mango-flavored chewing gum is, obviously, a blend of two flavors, providing a sweet and tropical taste.
This uncommon limeade-flavored chewing gum offers a sweet yet tangy taste, perfect for those looking for a refreshing burst of flavor.
This uncommon strawberry lemonade-flavored gum is sweet and tangy, with a cool and refreshing taste.
Wasabi is a rare spicy and bold flavor that's not often used in gum, but can offer a unique twist on traditional mint flavors.  It is quite invigorating.

Hibiscus is a floral and fruity flavor that's commonly used in teas, but apparently can be used in chewing gum as well.  While very rare and uncommon, it is a refreshing and unique taste that's less sweet than traditional fruit flavors.
Lavender is a rare, floral flavor, however, the cool thing of it is the lavender fragrance it leaves on your breath.  It can provide a slight sweetness and soothing, calming effect.
This rare bacon-flavored chewing gum offers a savory taste that was popular among meat lovers before the Cataclysm.  It's often associated with novelty flavors, and it's definitely an acquired taste.
Cola is a sweet and gentle flavor for those who enjoy a nice glass of cola.
Shaped like small ghost peppers, this is a really spicy, but also sweet flavor, for those brave enough.
This rare whiskey-flavored chewing gum offers a unique taste that was once popular among adults.  It can be a great conversation starter, if you had anyone to chat with.

This very rare saffron-flavored chewing gum offers an exotic and unique taste, with floral and earthy undertones.  It was commonly consumed in India and areas of the Persian Gulf, and this one is clearly imported.

This natural matcha green tea-flavored gum provides a distinct tea flavor that's known for its health benefits.  It's a great option for those who enjoy green tea but want a more convenient way to access the benefits.

This anise-flavored chewing gum is a bit like licorice, with a sweet and slightly spicy taste.  It used to be a popular flavor in Mediterranean and Middle Eastern regions, so obviously, this one is imported.

Pink peppercorn is a very rare chewing gum flavor that provides a slightly spicy and fruity taste, with notes of citrus and berry.  The flavor pairs well with desserts and can offer a unique and unexpected taste.
A flavor of chewing gum imported from Japan, also called 'man smell gum' or 'Otoko Kaoru'.  It offers a pleasant rose menthol taste.
Popcorn flavored chewing gum for those who once enjoyed the movies, goes well with cola chewing gum, heh.
Eggnog-flavored chewing gum, good all year round!
An exclusive, rare chewing gum flavor with a perfect mix of mint and chardonnay, for those who want to smell drunk, but stay sober.
Commune with your muse while chewing this absinthe-flavored gumball.
This rare cardamom-flavored chewing gum offers a warm and spicy taste, reminiscent of chai tea.  It was once a popular flavor in India and the Middle East, so this one is obviously imported.

description: A little hunk of glop that fell off a slime monster.  It doesn't seem hostile, but it does wiggle occasionally.
A large chunk of wax filled with honey.  Very tasty.
A large chunk of beeswax.  Despite being used in some cooking recipes, beeswax in itself is indigestible to humans.

A translucent hexagonal chunk of wax, filled with dense, milky, bitter and acidic-tasting jelly.  Though some hold it as a panacea, it doesn't have any medical benefit.  Still it is rich with the most beneficial substances the hive can produce.
A sugar-rich sticky substance, produced by aphids from plant sap.  Ants and bees love it.
//: It takes about 30 portions of honeydew to feed an adult (~2000 kkal). 2000 kkal is about 10 raw chunks of mutant meat, which is 250% toxins. Honeydew probably isn't as toxic as meat, so 30 portions of it would give you 180% of toxins.

description: This looks like a blueberry the size of your fist, but pinkish in color.  It has a strong but delicious aroma, but is clearly either mutated or of alien origin.
This looks like a handful of lemon-colored liquid which has taken a set, much like pre-Cataclysm Jello.  It has a strong but delicious aroma, but is clearly either mutated or of alien origin.
Humans might call this a Gray Delicious apple: large, gray, and smells even better than the Marloss.  If they didn't reject it for its alien origins.  But we know better.
A powder-like mix of cultured yeast, good for baking and brewing alike.
A powder-like mix of cultured yogurt bacteria, good for fermenting yogurt.
Some ground rice covered with a special kind of mold used for saccharification and fermentation in Japanese cuisine.
This bone meal can be used to craft fertilizer and some other things.
Dried and powdered gelatin, used as a gelling agent when mixed with water.

//: Same as the meat it's been made from.  It's additional ingredient compared to smoking, jerking, and dehydrating, so there's no incentive otherwise.
description: Fresh gelatin.  Not vegan-friendly!
This is a grayish bone meal made from rotten bones.
This chitin powder can be used to craft fertilizer and some other things.
A napkin.  Can be used for fires.
A piece of cardboard.
Canned beans.  A staple among canned goods, these are reputedly good for one's coronary health.
Dehydrated great northern beans.  Tasty and nutritious when cooked, virtually inedible when dry.
A hearty serving of cooked great northern beans.
Tofu, a soy protein crucial to East Asian cuisine.  It absorbs flavors very well and can be used as a meat alternative in many dishes.
Tofu, a soy protein crucial to East Asian cuisine.  It absorbs flavors very well and can be used as a meat alternative in many dishes.
Dehydrated tofu, sealed and still extra firm to last a long time.
Beige colored beans.  They have many uses, but in their raw form are fairly poisonous to humans.
Beige colored beans, dried until rock hard.  They'll need to be cooked or processed before use.
Raw soybeans still in their pod.  They can be cooked as-is or shelled for further processing, but in their raw form, they're toxic to humans.
Blood rice pudding is a pastry made from blood and rice grains.  Best with chopped peanuts, but also good to eat with various seasonings.
The best-seller from Foodplace, delicious food™, is made with real foodstuff and is guaranteed 100% edible!
Real foodstuff now in a pocket size format!
Wet, cooked lentils.  Humble and nutrient-rich, but pretty bland.
Ground coffee beans.  You can boil it into a mediocre stimulant, or something better if you had an atomic coffee pot.
Coffee grounds created through washing, cleaning, and roasting the pods from a Kentucky coffeetree.  They can be used to create coffee.
Honey, that stuff the bees make.  This variant is "candied honey", a variant of very thick consistence.  This honey won't spoil and is good for your digestion.
Canned tomato.  A staple in many pantries, and useful for many recipes.
This is a human brain soaked in a solution of highly toxic formaldehyde.  Eating this would be a terrible idea.
What cattle eat.  Mainly made of grass, silage or legumes.  It's perfect for ruminants.
A pile of cattle fodder, about enough to feed a goat or a sheep for a day.
A big heap of cattle fodder, enough to feed a cow for a day.
What birds eat.  Mainly made of seeds, silage or legumes.  It's perfect for small birds.
This is wet food for dogs, made from canned fresh meats.  It smells strange, but dogs seem to love it.
Dry morsels of dog food with a long shelf life.  Made from dried processed meats and grains, and enriched with vitamins and minerals.
This is wet food for cats, made from canned fresh meats.  It has a pungent aroma that cats seem to love.
Dry kibbles of cat food with a long shelf life.  Made from dried processed meats and grains, and enriched with vitamins and minerals.
Some grass, edible by grazers and ruminants only.  Seeing this item is a bug.
A small plant or flower, edible by grazers and ruminants only.  Seeing this item is a bug.
Some underbrush, edible by ruminants only.  Seeing this item is a bug.
Some nectar.  Seeing this item is a bug.
A paper sachet with tea leaves inside.  Put it into boiling water to make a cup of black tea.
A paper sachet with tea leaves inside.  Put it into boiling water to make a cup of green tea.
A paper sachet with leaves and fruit parts inside.  Put it into boiling water to make a cup of fruit tea.
A paper sachet with dried wild herbs inside.  Put it into boiling water to make a cup of herbal tea.
A paper sachet with dried dandelion roots inside.  Put it into boiling water to make a cup of dandelion tea.
A paper sachet with dried chamomile inside.  Put it into boiling water to make a cup of chamomile tea.
A small packet of commercial instant coffee powder.  No creamer or sweetener added.
Raw hide soaking in a dilute acid solution to extract collagen.  After 24 hours the solution can be strained to extract fresh gelatin.
Freshly extracted gelatin in a dilute acid solution.  It needs to be strained to separate the gelatin from the acid.
I am an item used in faction camps.  If you see this description, it is a bug.
Dry leftovers that remain after extracting the oil from nuts or seeds.
Blodplättar is not your average pancake.  It does not taste of blood at all and it tastes like a crispier black pudding.  Made with wheat-free flour.
A common earthworm.
//1: 1 earthworm has such a small amount of vitamins, i'm not sure it's possible to model them.

description: A handful of earthworms.
Dried, cooked and ground earthworms.
//: Dried weight is about 15% of normal

description: A handful of fried earthworms, cooked in salt.
A handful of common earthworms, boiled to remove impurities.
A small gastropod harvested from the bushes.  Dangerous to consume raw but can be prepared if you get enough of them.
A mass of ground seeds that are ready to be pressed into oil.
A thick mass of ground nuts that are ready to be pressed into oil.
A swarm of honey bees, displaced from the hive.  Without the support and nutrients of an apiary, or taking root somewhere, they will die in a few days.
//: While bees have mass and volume, it is easier to round to zero for the purposes of the game.
